p: The results of antioxidant activity of EOs were expressed as the mean of three replications ± standard deviation (±SD). Variance analysis of the data (one-way ANOVA) was performed using SPSS 12.0 software and means were separated according to Student–Newman-Keuls test at p < 0.05. Probit analysis [ 27] was conducted on the corrected mortality data [ 28] to estimate lethal concentrations (LC 50 and LC 90) with their 95% confidence intervals by SPSS 12.0 Statistical Software. LC values were considered significantly different when their respective 95% confidence intervals did not overlap.
